interfaces

Interface IAction

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Actions

    public interface IAction
    Interface for KeywordProvider provided Action Keywords. Action Keywords are any Keyword intended to perform a user simulated action using Keyboard amd Mouse on a web page
    Author:
    Mathew Carrigan

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • selectByText

        ActionKeyword selectByText(org.openqa.selenium.By locator,
                           java.lang.String name)
        Select an input dropdown/combobox by the name of the option to select. The By locator MUST be an input
        Parameters:
        locator - By locator for the input
        name - Text of the input option to select
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • selectByText

        ActionKeyword selectByText(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                           java.lang.String name)
        Select an input dropdown/combobox by the name of the option to select. The WebElement MUST be an input
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement for the input
        name - Text of the input option to select
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • selectByIndex

        ActionKeyword selectByIndex(org.openqa.selenium.By locator,
                            int index)
        Select and input dropdown/combox option by the Index(nth) of the options. Index starts at 0 so first option would be 0th index. The By locator MUST be an input element
        Parameters:
        locator - By locator for the input
        index - 0-based Index of DropDown options to select
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • selectByIndex

        ActionKeyword selectByIndex(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                            int index)
        Select and input dropdown/combox option by the Index(nth) of the options. Index starts at 0 so first option would be 0th index. The WebElement MUST be an input element
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement for the input
        index - 0-based Index of DropDown options to select
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

        ActionKeyword click(org.openqa.selenium.By locator)
        Perform a mouse click on the provided Element
        Parameters:
        locator - By locator of the element to click on
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • click

        Parameters:
        element - WebElement click on
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • sendKeys

        ActionKeyword sendKeys(org.openqa.selenium.By locator,
                       java.lang.String text)
        Sends the provided String to an element. Used for text and password input boxes Can supply an actual String like 'send these keys' or use Selenium's Keys class for other keyboard keys like Enter, Return, Tab, etc...
        Parameters:
        locator - By locator of the element to send Keys/Text to
        text - Text or Selenium Keys @see Keys
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance
        See Also:
        Keys

      • sendKeys

        ActionKeyword sendKeys(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                       java.lang.String text)
        Sends the provided String to an element. Used for text and password input boxes Can supply an actual String like 'send these keys' or use Selenium's Keys class for other keyboard keys like Enter, Return, Tab, etc...
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement to send Keys/Text to
        text - Text or Selenium Keys @see org.openqa.selenium.Keys
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance
        See Also:
        Keys

      • executeJavaScript

        ActionKeyword executeJavaScript(java.lang.String js)
        Run custom JavaScript command. Uses Selenium's IJavascriptExecutor
        Parameters:
        js - Javascript to run
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • executeJavaScript

        ActionKeyword executeJavaScript(java.lang.String js,
                                java.lang.Object... args)
        Run custom JavaScript command. Uses Selenium's IJavascriptExecutor
        Parameters:
        js - Javascript to run
        args - list of objects to send along with the Javascript text. For example you can send a WebElement if your intended JS script acts on a specific WebElement
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • mouseTo

        ActionKeyword mouseTo(org.openqa.selenium.By locator)
        Moves the mouse focus to the given element. Similiar to Hover but without any time delay
        Parameters:
        locator - By locator of the element to move to
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • mouseTo

        ActionKeyword mouseTo(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element)
        Moves the mouse focus to the given element. Similiar to Hover but without any time delay
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement to move to
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • clickAndDrag

        ActionKeyword clickAndDrag(org.openqa.selenium.By source,
                           org.openqa.selenium.By target)
        Performs a Click and Drag action from a source element to a target element. This will click and hold on the source element and move the cursor to the target element and release there
        Parameters:
        source - By locator of the element to be clicked on and dragged
        target - By locator of the element to drag to and release on
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • clickAndDrag

        ActionKeyword clickAndDrag(org.openqa.selenium.By source,
                           org.openqa.selenium.WebElement target)
        Performs a Click and Drag action from a source element to a target element. This will click and hold on the source element and move the cursor to the target element and release there
        Parameters:
        source - By locator of the element to be clicked on and dragged
        target - WebElement to drag to and release on
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • clickAndDrag

        ActionKeyword clickAndDrag(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement source,
                           org.openqa.selenium.By target)
        Performs a Click and Drag action from a source element to a target element. This will click and hold on the source element and move the cursor to the target element and release there
        Parameters:
        source - WebElement to be clicked on and dragged
        target - By locator of the element to drag to and release on
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • clickAndDrag

        ActionKeyword clickAndDrag(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement source,
                           org.openqa.selenium.WebElement target)
        Performs a Click and Drag action from a source element to a target element. This will click and hold on the source element and move the cursor to the target element and release there
        Parameters:
        source - WebElement to be clicked on and dragged
        target - WebElement to drag to and release on
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • clickAndDrag

        ActionKeyword clickAndDrag(org.openqa.selenium.By source,
                           int offsetX,
                           int offsetY)
        Performs a Click and Drag action from a source element to a target Location offset relative to the source location. Example xOffset and yOffset of 100 each will drag to 100 pixels Right and 100 Pixels Left of the source element
        Parameters:
        source - By locator of element to be clicked on and dragged
        offsetX - number of pixels along the X axis. Positive is right, Negative is left, and 0 is same position on the X axis
        offsetY - number of pixels along the Y axis. Positive is up, Negative is down, and 0 is the same position along the Y axis
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • clickAndDrag

        ActionKeyword clickAndDrag(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement source,
                           int offsetX,
                           int offsetY)
        Performs a Click and Drag action from a source element to a target Location offset relative to the source location. Example xOffset and yOffset of 100 each will drag to 100 pixels Right and 100 Pixels Left of the source element
        Parameters:
        source - WebElement to be clicked on and dragged
        offsetX - number of pixels along the X axis. Positive is right, Negative is left, and 0 is same position on the X axis
        offsetY - number of pixels along the Y axis. Positive is up, Negative is down, and 0 is the same position along the Y axis
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • selectCheckbox

        ActionKeyword selectCheckbox(org.openqa.selenium.By locator)
        Makes a checkbox selected. This will first check is the checkbox is already selected and only perform a click if it is not already selected
        Parameters:
        locator - By locator of the checkbox element to make selected. Element MUST be a checkbox input element
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • selectCheckbox

        ActionKeyword selectCheckbox(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element)
        Makes a checkbox selected. This will first check is the checkbox is already selected and only perform a click if it is not already selected
        Parameters:
        element - Checkbox WebElement to make selected. Element MUST be a checkbox input element
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • unselectCheckbox

        ActionKeyword unselectCheckbox(org.openqa.selenium.By locator)
        Makes a checkbox un-selected. This will first check is the checkbox is already selected and only perform a click if it currently selected
        Parameters:
        locator - By locator of the checkbox element to make unselected. Element MUST be a checkbox input element
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • unselectCheckbox

        ActionKeyword unselectCheckbox(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element)
        Makes a checkbox un-selected. This will first check is the checkbox is already selected and only perform a click if it currently selected
        Parameters:
        element - Checkbox WebElement to make un-selected. Element MUST be a checkbox input element
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • selectRadioOptionByIndex

        ActionKeyword selectRadioOptionByIndex(org.openqa.selenium.By parent,
                                       int index)
        Selects an option for a radio group input by the 0-based index of the option. The first option would have index of 0 Alternative of this method is to just perform a click action on a specific uniquely found Radio Button
        Parameters:
        parent - By locator for the radio group
        index - Index of option to select
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • selectRadioOptionByIndex

        ActionKeyword selectRadioOptionByIndex(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement parent,
                                       int index)
        Selects an option for a radio group input by the 0-based index of the option. The first option would have index of 0 Alternative of this method is to just perform a click action on a specific uniquely found Radio Button
        Parameters:
        parent - WebElement of the radio group
        index - Index of option to select
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • selectRadioOptionByValue

        ActionKeyword selectRadioOptionByValue(org.openqa.selenium.By parent,
                                       java.lang.String value)
        Selects an option for a radio group inoput based on the Value attribute of the option
        Parameters:
        parent - By locator of of the radio group element
        value - Exact value of the value attribute for the desired radio option to be selected
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • selectRadioOptionByValue

        ActionKeyword selectRadioOptionByValue(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement parent,
                                       java.lang.String value)
        Selects an option for a radio group inoput based on the Value attribute of the option
        Parameters:
        parent - WebElement of the radio group
        value - Exact value of the value attribute for the desired radio option to be selected
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • scrollToElement

        ActionKeyword scrollToElement(org.openqa.selenium.By locator)
        Uses the IJavascriptExecutor to scroll the browser to the provided element
        Parameters:
        locator - By locator for the Element to scroll to
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • scrollToElement

        ActionKeyword scrollToElement(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element)
        Uses the IJavascriptExecutor to scroll the browser to the provided element
        Parameters:
        element - WebElement to scroll to
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • switchToFrame

        ActionKeyword switchToFrame(java.lang.String idOrName)
        Switches Selenium's currently focused DOM to that of an IFrame in order to interact with any WebElements inside the given iFrame
        Parameters:
        idOrName - Name or ID of the iFrame element to switch to
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • switchToFrame

        ActionKeyword switchToFrame(int index)
        Switches Selenium's currently focused DOM to that of an IFrame in order to interact with any WebElements inside the given iFrame
        Parameters:
        index - switches to an iFrame of the nth index. For example, if it is required to always switch to the 3rd iFrame, then provide 2 as the index as index is 0 based
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • switchToFrame

        ActionKeyword switchToFrame(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement frame)
        Switches Selenium's currently focused DOM to that of an IFrame in order to interact with any WebElements inside the given iFrame
        Parameters:
        frame - WebElement of the iFrame to switch to
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • switchToFrame

        ActionKeyword switchToFrame(org.openqa.selenium.By frame)
        Switches Selenium's currently focused DOM to that of an IFrame in order to interact with any WebElements inside the given iFrame
        Parameters:
        frame - by locator of the iFrame element to switch to
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance

      • switchToDefaultContent

        ActionKeyword switchToDefaultContent()
        Switches Selenium's DOM focus to the main parent DOM also known as the default DOM
        Returns:
        an ActionKeyword instance
